intro: Gomesa calimaniana, commonly known as the Calimanian gomesa, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
